summary: Ilatria is a marriable Nord female rogue standalone follower, which means that she'll look just like in the screenshots, no matter what mods you have installed or even if you don't have any. She's based on my current player character and has some tricks up her sleeves that you don't always see on normal followers.
descriptionHtml:
[center][img]http://i.imgur.com/FZ4eDCb.png[/img][/center]

[heading][color=green]--- The House & Dungeon mod ---[/color][/heading]
The mod is finished as far as I'm concerned but do let me know if you run into any problems. I've also got a house / dungeon mod! Go check it out by clicking [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/31124/]here![/url]
Includes a dungeon that you need to complete in order to gain access to Ilatrias (and your) new home (more info below)!


[heading][color=green]--- Updates! ---[/color][/heading]
-- Warpaint free version of Ilatria available in the files section! --

Added a patch version for those who also have my "Ilatria and the Tomb of the Old" mod.
This patch moves Ilatria to her home in the Groizen'Zor palace and gives her something to wear by default.

Version 1.5 is out. Ilatria should now be fully Standalone, thanks to my IRL friend who I used as a guinea pig to test the mod out without having any other texture changing mods installed.
In addition, the mod is now loose file free. All the resources are now packed conveniently in one .bsa file!

She's a little more powerful (a bit more health, magica and stamina, but not too much).
Did fixes to health, stamina and magica weights (she will choose to increase her stats a bit more logically on level up)
She will level with you to the maximum player character level of 81 (Still has the min. level of 10).
Added more perks that will benefit her style of combat.

To update Ilatria's stats, do the following:
[list=1]
[*]Go in game, take out all items from Ilatria that you wish to keep.
[*]Send her back home (Dismiss).
[*]Save your game.
[*]Close the game and boot back up again with ilatria.esp [b][u]deactivated[/u][/b].
[*]Load the last save and save in a new slot.
[*]Close the game.
[*]Activate Ilatria.esp, go to Whiterun and take your "upgraded" Ilatria with you! :)
[/list]

[heading][color=green]Introducing: Ilatria[/heading][/color]

She's a young Nord girl looking for adventure at the Whiterun Temple of Kynareth! And if you choose to take her with you, you'll notice that
she's more than capable of taking care of herself.
For maximum efficiency, give her a pair of good daggers, some sweet armor and she'll surely take care of
those bad guys for you, because Ilatria is well trained in the arts of assassination and subtlety.
And if you happen to talk to her with an Amulet of Mara equipped, she'll consider giving her hand in marriage ;)



She's well trained!

[list]
[*]Ilatria has the skills to walk on traps without activating them.
[*]She's well equipped for stealth missions (3/5 sneak perks and silent footsteps)
[*]Can heal herself (increased magica regeneration, novice and apprentice restoration perks)
[*]Quiet casting
[*]Extra pockets to carry your burdens!
[*]And much more!
[/list]



[heading][color=green]Background of the mod:[/heading][/color]

She was originally designed to be the exact copy of my current player character so that I could take my
sweet Ilatria with me on my journeys on my other characters as well, but after receiving positive feedback
from my friends, I decided to go the extra mile and make her into a standalone format and ask for the
permissions from the original creators of all the resources that I used to create her so that anyone
could enjoy the company of Ilatria without having to worry about which mods to install to make her look
the way she should.

Keep in mind that I had absolutely zero experience on Skyrim modding before this mod, so if you find
anything wrong, let me know and I'll see if I can fix it.


[heading][color=green]Installing:[/heading][/color]
Download the .rar file. Unpack the contents (Two folders, named Meshes and Textures and Ilatria.esp) and
place them in your Skyrim's Data folder (commonly located in Program FilesSteamSteamAppscommonskyrim)

[heading][color=green]Uninstalling:[/heading][/color]
Remove all items that you'd wish to keep from Ilatria's inventory, give her a hug for goodbye and delete the files that you installed:
Open up SkyrimData folder, use windows explorer to search for "Ilatria".
Remove all folders and files that contain the word "Ilatria" (there shouldn't be that many)
Done!

[heading][color=green]FAQ:[/heading][/color]
Q: Why is she naked when I met her the first time?
A: When creating the follower, I could choose to equip her with a standard set of items in the same fashion as the normal
followers, like housecarls. There's one problem with that though. The equipment set is not shown in the followers
inventory and in addition, equipping your own armor or clothes on her is annoying, so I decided to just add the monk robes
and pair of boots in her inventory as normal items. She should equip them once you ask her to follow you and exit the Temple,
but I'd recommend giving her some better items if you're planning on using her in demanding missions.

Q: What class is she?
A: She's Combat Assassin by definition. If you want to get the best of her, give her two good daggers and she'll put them
to good use.

Q: What level is she?
A: I've set Ilatria to scale with your level. Her minimum level is 10 and her maximum level is 81. In Skyrim, the time you enter
the same area as the follower the first time defines the level of that follower, though the level and skill levels can be refreshed
to reflect your current ones using some mods (UFO - Ultimate Follower Overhaul for example).

Q: Where can I find her once I've installed me mod?
A: At the Temple of Kynareth, Whiterun.


[heading][color=green]-------- Credits & Thanks--------[/heading][/color]
Psychos1s - for his awesome work on the Temptress Race and the source of most of Ilatria's face textures.
Click the image below to visit the mod page of the Temptress Race:
[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/18717][img]http://farm9.staticflickr.com/8434/7722550578_0ed2414e53.jpg[/img][/url]

apachii - for the best Skyrim Haircuts and the source of Ilatria's hair as well:
[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/10168/]Link to ApachiiSkyHair[/url]


dimon99 - for the best looking female body seen in gaming and the source of Ilatria's body meshes and textures:
[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/6709/]Link to DIMONIZED UNP female body[/url]

nevenbridge81 - for all of those pretty eyes and Ilatria's too:
[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/3589/]Natural Eyes[/url]

Bethesda - for creating such an epic gaming experience and for all the rest of the body pieces that I've used.

[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/users/4825044/?]mysticentity[/url] and The Creation Kids for the beautiful '[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/65163/?]Forever Free[/url]' logo
